topic.title: What's the purpose of `ajax_key` in `sites.json` in /zeronet/data/ ?
topic.body: What's the purpose of `ajax_key` in `sites.json` in /zeronet/data/ ?

topic.title: PGP with ECC. Any compatibility problem?
topic.body:
I'm thinking of moving from RSA to ECC for my private key. 
Will there be any problem in applications' resolving the contents signed by ECC private key or encrypted by ECC public key? Those applications could be thunderbird or old gpg, etc.

I learned ECC is far better than RSA after studying about bitcoin private key generation after reading [Kaffie's comment](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1528039084_1NEAivkF2GyHcnRQfJjahZD5XyWfJv1a1W#comment_625_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh).

Somehow i tend to prefer Google over duckduck as it seem to me that it returns most relevant results, though it is a subjective opinion. I do not care much if google knows what i am searching for and what sites i visit. [...]

Google is scanning ur anatomy and gives the collected data to NSA. 
Google users are monitored like a wild animals in Savana like animals are monitored by scientists. 
Tags u, makes report about u, and organizes those information for the private society which is never known to you.

1534502068_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_24_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): public IP in order to connect other user

Do you mean that Dat: can connect to the one under smartphone's wibro network? 
For example if I turn on my smartphone in the middle of nowhere there's no wifi so that it's placing itself under the subnetwork of the APs which the mobile company installed everywhere. In this case, you don't have a fixed IP address, so technically no one can connect to your smartphone's or smartphone tethered PC's server. 

Does Dat: work even in this scenario?

1550331862_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> [robione](#comment_7_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): using USB is a bad idea. It's not meant for storage like this and it's very easy to corrupt your entire setup.get a used NAS instead to fill with HDDs.or build your own from an old computer with linux and ZFS.

What's wrong with USB?

IMHO raid 5 or 6 both are not good ideas.
It's just a HDD failure immune system not providing backup. Even though setting a backup system with raid 5 or 6, its efficiency of cost drops far worse. Even the writing speed is terrible. I'd recommend RAID 0 or compatible with backups. raid0 with 3 or more HDDs via USB 3.0 will suffice.
Well scheduled periodic backup process will rather help better.
Why don't u try any cheap 4 bay HDD adapter?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_51_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Because i found very well priced particular product in my country. My product of choice is external USB3.0 2.5" (enclosed) HDDs (yes i want 2.5 because of lower noise mainly) and i do not want to break warranty by removing enclosures. So i was looking for USB solution. Which exist as i linked in my leading post.I also do not want to spend additional lets say 100-150 USD per HDD + additional lets say 200USD for the used NAS device.I agree that USB may not be as reliable as a NAS or as a HDDs mounted inside the computer, but i would add these drives to my backup power supply and into powered USB hub placed the way so it is unlikely i accidentaly disconnect drive/s. [...]

I'd like to say that sometimes a bit delayed backups in a different physical set of HDDs help the situation especially when the data being destroyed by your mistake not by the accident.
`Oh, what did I do??? I have to recover them again.. Huh.. ` :)

2.5" HDD is more stubborn against physical impact and quieter as u mentioned. And it's handy. 
But speed and price per byte are higher than 3.5"s.
If u're not a HDD carrying guy, there's no merit.

1548340010_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
What is better than normal proxy server without VPN? 
Regarding IP leak matter, it seems rather dangerous, isn't it? 
In case of proxy connection setting in browser, if the proxy server fails, the client also fails in connecting to any webpage or so. There can't be any real IP leakage.

1552991484_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
I don't think it's anything to do with ISP in regard with Wifi connections.
Rather, it's something to do with maximum CPU & disk I/O resources which could be handled at once. 
Your VPS provider must have a setting which limits the both in their side. 
You may need a kind of mirror site or something.

1552755084_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
In Korea, in internet cafe, it is very common nowadays. 
Network storage server + 20 to 50 PCs are common and work seamlessly.

But in case of via-wifi access it doesn't work as nicely as in case of nominal cabled network connection.

1558975127_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> [robione](#comment_10_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): usually not an extension, but a tab.you can try OneTab and All Tabs Helper extensions.I have 1800+ tabs.

["We use Google's favicon generator to retrieve favicons for each domain in your list, but only the domain name is used and the full URL is never disclosed."](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/onetab/?src=search)

> [robione](#comment_10_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): usually not an extension, but a tab.you can try OneTab and All Tabs Helper extensions.I have 1800+ tabs.

LoadTabOnSelect addon is better I think. 
If u get too many tabs on a window, open new firefox window and return the heavy window, then close the window. Once closed, push ctrl-shift-n to recover the closed window but other tabs except the focused tab not being loaded but still having their own tab titles displayed.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_79_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): That is not exactly what i need. I think i would rather need Firefox to freeze already running tabs so it does not use CPU.

That's why you have to close a window with hundreds of tabs while leaving at least one window so that u don't need to restart firefox but you only need to ctrl-shift-n to reload the very window with such hundreds of tabs with the only focused tab reloaded while the remaining hundreds of tabs still frozen.
